name: UpdateRumRetentionFilter
description:
Update a RUM retention filter for a RUM application.

Use this tool to modify the retention filter settings of a RUM application. It returns the updated RUM retention filter details if the request succeeds.

parameters.name: rum_application_id
parameters.description: The ID of the RUM application to update the retention filter. Required for identifying the application.

parameters.name: retention_filter_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the retention filter to be updated.

parameters.name: filter_id
parameters.description: UUID of the retention filter to be updated.

value_schema.description: ID of retention filter in UUID.

parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.description: Specifies the resource type for the retention filter. Must be 'retention_filters'.

value_schema.description: The type of the resource. The value should always be retention_filters.

parameters.name: rum_event_type_filter
parameters.description: Specifies the type of RUM events to filter on, such as 'session', 'view', 'action', etc.

value_schema.description: The type of RUM events to filter on.

parameters.name: filter_name
parameters.description: The name of the RUM retention filter to update.

value_schema.description: The name of a RUM retention filter.

parameters.name: rum_retention_filter_query
parameters.description: The query string used to define criteria for the RUM retention filter.

value_schema.description: The query string for a RUM retention filter.

parameters.name: sample_rate
parameters.description: The sample rate for a RUM retention filter, an integer between 0 and 100, specifying the percentage of data to sample.

value_schema.description: The sample rate for a RUM retention filter, between 0 and 100.

parameters.name: enable_retention_filter
parameters.description: Set to true to enable the retention filter. Set to false to disable it.

value_schema.description: Whether the retention filter is enabled.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: data.attributes.enabled
parameters.description: Whether the retention filter is enabled.

value_schema.description: Whether the retention filter is enabled.

parameters.name: data.attributes.event_type
parameters.description: The type of RUM events to filter on.

value_schema.description: The type of RUM events to filter on.

parameters.name: data.attributes.name
parameters.description: The name of a RUM retention filter.

value_schema.description: The name of a RUM retention filter.

parameters.name: data.attributes.query
parameters.description: The query string for a RUM retention filter.

value_schema.description: The query string for a RUM retention filter.

parameters.name: data.attributes.sample_rate
parameters.description: The sample rate for a RUM retention filter, between 0 and 100.

value_schema.description: The sample rate for a RUM retention filter, between 0 and 100.

parameters.name: data.id
parameters.description: ID of retention filter in UUID.

value_schema.description: ID of retention filter in UUID.

parameters.name: data.type
parameters.description: The type of the resource. The value should always be retention_filters.

value_schema.description: The type of the resource. The value should always be retention_filters.
